009package imagingbook.common.color.edge;
010
011import java.awt.Point;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
019
020/**
021 * Represents a chain of connected edge points.
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public class EdgeTrace implements Iterable<PntInt> {
026        
027        private final ArrayList<PntInt> edgePoints;
028        
029        public EdgeTrace() {
030                this.edgePoints = new ArrayList<>();
031        }
032        
033        public int size() {
034                return edgePoints.size();
035        }
036        
037        public void addPoint(PntInt p) {
038                edgePoints.add(p);
039        }
040        
041        public PntInt getPoint(int idx) {
042                return (idx >= 0 && idx < edgePoints.size()) ? 
043                                edgePoints.get(idx) : null;
044        }
045        
046        public PntInt[] getPointArray() {
047                return edgePoints.toArray(new PntInt[0]);
048        }
049
050        @Override
051        public Iterator<PntInt> iterator() {
052                return edgePoints.iterator();
053        }
054        
055        
056        /**
057         * For backward compatibility only.
058         * @return a list of AWT {@link Point} instances.
059         */
060        protected List<Point> getAwtPoints() {
061                List<Point> awtPoints = new ArrayList<>();
062                for (PntInt p : edgePoints) {
063                        awtPoints.add(new Point(p.x, p.y));
064                }
065                return awtPoints;
066        }
067        
068        @Override
069        public String toString() {
070                return String.format("%s: start=%s length=%d", 
071                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getPoint(0).toString(), size());
072        }
073        
074        // ---------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        public static void main(String[] args) {
077                EdgeTrace trace = new EdgeTrace();
078                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(1,2));
079                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(3,4));
080                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(5,6));
081                
082                for (Pnt2d p : trace) {
083                        System.out.println(p);
084                }
085                
086                System.out.println();
087                trace.addPoint(PntInt.from(7,8));
088                
089                for (PntInt p : trace.getPointArray()) {
090                        System.out.println(p);
091                }
092                
093                System.out.println();
094                for (Point p : trace.getAwtPoints()) {
095                        System.out.println(p);
096                }
097                
098                System.out.println(trace.getPoint(3));
099                System.out.println(trace.getPoint(4));
100                
101                PntInt[] copy = Arrays.copyOfRange(trace.getPointArray(),0, 7);
102                System.out.println(copy.length);
103                for (PntInt p : copy) {
104                        System.out.println(p);
105                }
106        }
107
108}
